title: Anfernee Simons impresses offensively as Celtics roll over short-handed Cavaliers: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics Simons was locked in on Sunday – 6-for-9 from behind the arc with a team-high 21 points in 25 minutes.
Anfernee Simons scored 21 points Sunday against the Cavaliers.
Michael Dwyer/AP Photo ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Historic Beacon Hill brownstone sat vacant for 20 years — now it’s listed at $15.5M
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Luxury Homes The interior had been stripped of its historic features, so it was converted to modern living on the inside while honoring its 1830s architecture on the outside.
The courtyard at 94 Mount Bernon St.
in Boston.

title: Patriots Stock Watch: Who stood out, struggled in win over Saints
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Kayshon Boutte and DeMario Douglas both had strong showings in New Orleans.
DeMario Douglas and Kayshon Boutte both dominated Sunday in New Orleans.
(AP Photo/Maria Lysaker) For the first time since 2022, the Patriots have won three games in a row.

title: Kayshon Boutte had a ‘full-circle moment’ during two touchdown performance at Superdome
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots The Louisiana native said playing in his home state for the first time as a pro was emotional.
Kayshon Boutte celebrates with teammates Sunday against the New Orleans Saints.
AP Photo/Gerald Herbert Kayshon Boutte grew up in New Iberia, Louisiana, about two hours from New Orleans.

title: What happened with that OPI penalty on Stefon Diggs? Here’s the official explanation
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "On that play, we ruled blocking downfield by number eight, early during the play.
" Stefon Diggs during the Patriots' win over the Saints in New Orleans.

Matthew J Lee/Globe staff The offensive pass interference penalty assessed to Stefon Diggs in the second quarter of the Patriots’ 25-19 win over the Saints on Sunday wiped out a 61-yard touchdown catch from DeMario Douglas.

title: ‘Last year’s in the past’: Drake Maye on the Patriots’ early success in 2025
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots "We just wanted to keep building momentum.
" Drake Maye throws during the first half of the Patriots' win over the Saints.
Gerald Herbert/AP Photo By Hayden Bird October 12, 2025 | 7:36 PM 2 minutes to read After leading the Patriots to a third consecutive win, Drake Maye heeded the words of his coach.

title: 10 stats to contextualize the Patriots’ hot start to the season
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: New England Patriots They're off to their best start since 2019.
Stefon Diggs reacts on the sideline Sunday afternoon.
Maria Lysaker/AP Photo It’s still relatively early in the season, but at the moment, it appears as though the Patriots are back.

title: Patriots’ posted Mike Vrabel’s locker room speech after win vs. Saints
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots "We will never get to the point where we're not going to celebrate wins.
" Mike Vrabel during the Patriots' win against the Saints.
Matthew J.

title: 5 takeaways from the Patriots’ close victory against New Orleans
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots All of a sudden, the Patriots are on a three-game win streak.
Kayshon Boutte celebrates a touchdown with Hunter Henry and Mack Hollins.

title: Community shows support for Roslindale business owner after Pride flag torn down
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The owner of Roslindale Gourmet Foods Market, Russ & Mimi’s, discovered her business’ Pride flag had been ripped down overnight.
The LGBTQ Pride flag was intentionally torn down from its flagpole outside the foods store Russ & Mimi's in Roslindale.
David L.
